CatDescriptText: Mr. Samuel Yates, porter, 221 N. Euclid Avenue, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 11, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you believe churches of any denomination receive appreciation financial help from racketeers?" answer reads: "Yes, I do, and I believe that both the large and small churches receive the monies.  The majority of the contributions are rather large.  I don't see anything wrong in the church receiving the contributions, that's if it will do the church good and will be used in the right way."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Samuel Yates, wearing dark hat, moustache, dark sweater, and light colored jacket with plush collar, standing with hands in pockets in front of store windows, one with pastry display and signs that read "Blackeye Peas 19c 35c"
